siteConfig.title: Peterbilt 520EV
siteConfig.description: Official Hero Site for the Peterbilt 520EV

specs.description: Effortlessly handle up to 1100 trash bins pickups on a single charge
Ultra quiet operation - Perfect for minimizing noise
Regenerative braking extends range while reducing maintenance costs
Unlock up to $160K in combined State and Federal Tax Credits
Long lasting 500 kWh battery with up to 120 miles of range
Drive clean with zero tailpipe emissions
Ergonomic cab design enhances driver comfort and productivity
Versatile configurations including right hand stand up, left-hand or right-hand drive and dual-seated drive

chargingOptions.description: The Peterbilt 520EV charges quickly and efficiently, with its lithium iron phosphate (LFP) batteries fully recharging in just 3-4 hours using DC fast charging. Designed for predictable refuse routes, it minimizes downtime, maximizes uptime, and offers a cost-effective, sustainable energy solution for fleet operations.

technology.title: The Line-Up
technology.description: The Peterbilt EV family offers a cutting-edge lineup of zero-emission vehicles to meet the diverse needs of modern fleets. With the 220EV, 520EV, and 579EV, Peterbilt delivers exceptional performance, reliability, and durability while eliminating tailpipe emissions. Powered by advanced batteries, these vehicles feature fast charging, customizable designs, and Peterbilt's legacy of support, enabling businesses to achieve sustainability without sacrificing productivity.

technology.title: Peterbilt 220EV
technology.description: The Peterbilt 220EV delivers up to 200 miles of range, perfect for urban delivery and regional operations. Its compact cab-over design enhances maneuverability and visibility, ideal for tight city streets. With fast charging in just 1-2 hours, downtime is minimized, and driver comfort is prioritized with a spacious, ergonomic interior. The 220EV offers sustainable performance without compromising productivity.

technology.title: Peterbilt 579EV
technology.description: The Peterbilt 579EV is a Class 8 truck built for regional haul and drayage, offering a 150-mile range per charge with regenerative braking to boost efficiency and reduce wear. Powered by lithium iron phosphate batteries and delivering up to 670 horsepower, it combines aerodynamic design with a comfortable, ergonomic interior. With fast charging in just 3 hours, it ensures minimal downtime for sustainable heavy-duty operations.

businessPoints.title: Commercial Clean Tax Credit
businessPoints.description: The Peterbilt 520EV qualifies for the Commercial Clean Vehicle Tax Credit, providing businesses with a significant federal tax incentive. For electric vehicles with a gross vehicle weight rating (GVWR) over 14,000 pounds—such as the 520EV—the credit can reach up to $40,000. This incentive lowers the upfront cost for companies transitioning to zero-emission vehicles. By taking advantage of this tax credit, businesses can reduce expenses while advancing their sustainability goals, making the 520EV an economically and environmentally smart choice for modern fleets.

businessPoints.alt: Hybrid and Zero-Emission Truck Voucher Incentive Project (HVIP)
businessPoints.title: Hybrid and Zero-Emission Truck Voucher Incentive Project (HVIP)
businessPoints.description: The Peterbilt 520EV is eligible for incentives through California's Hybrid and Zero-Emission Truck and Bus Voucher Incentive Project (HVIP). HVIP provides point-of-sale discounts designed to promote the adoption of zero-emission commercial vehicles within the state. For the 520EV, businesses can receive a base voucher amount of up to $120,000 per vehicle, dramatically lowering the initial cost of adding this electric truck to their fleet. By leveraging HVIP incentives, companies can achieve significant savings while supporting California's efforts to reduce emissions and advance clean transportation solutions.

businessPoints.alt: Double the Incentive with HVIP Small Fleet Adjustment
businessPoints.title: Double the Incentive with HVIP Small Fleet Adjustment
businessPoints.description: The Peterbilt 520EV qualifies for substantial incentives through California's Hybrid and Zero-Emission Truck and Bus Voucher Incentive Project (HVIP). For the 520EV, the base voucher amount is up to $120,000 per vehicle. Additionally, a 100% base adjustment is available, doubling the voucher to $240,000 per vehicle. This enhanced incentive applies to public and nonprofit fleets with 20 or fewer vehicles over 8,500 lbs, as well as private fleets meeting the same size criteria and annual revenues under $15 million. These incentives make the 520EV an attractive and accessible option for businesses transitioning to zero-emission vehicles.

businessPoints.title: The Clean Machine
businessPoints.description: The Clean Machine revolutionizes waste management with its commitment to sustainability and zero emissions. Designed for commercial, residential and suburban refuse collection, this electric vehicle eliminates the noise and pollution associated with traditional diesel trucks. Its advanced electric powertrain offers impressive torque and energy efficiency, allowing operators to complete demanding routes while significantly reducing their carbon footprint. Equipped with regenerative braking and a robust battery system, the 520EV is both environmentally and economically forward-thinking, showcasing Peterbilt’s dedication to creating cleaner, quieter, and more efficient solutions for modern fleet operations.

businessPoints.title: Customer Spotlight
businessPoints.description: Peterbilt recently delivered three Model 520EV electric trucks to Waste Connections of New York, marking a significant step in their commitment to sustainability. These zero-emission vehicles will support waste collection operations, combining advanced technology with Peterbilt’s renowned durability and performance. The delivery underscores Waste Connections’ dedication to reducing their environmental impact and Peterbilt’s leadership in providing innovative electric solutions for the commercial vehicle industry.
